data.title: Terminal: Cannot rename task terminal
data.body:
testing #31784

ubuntu 16.04
Version 1.15.0-insider
Commit f39385b8326671dc6389f21f8c2e2f6afdb352a1
Date 2017-08-01T05:10:12.703Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0
Architecture x64


Start a task that runs in a terminal
`cmd+p` then `Terminal: switch active terminal`
Hover over the terminal that has a task
Click on the gear

result: nothing happens

I would expect to be able to rename it since it shows up in the list and I can rename the others.

data.title: After deleting all terminals, can no longer rename using gear
data.body:
testing #31784 

Version 1.15.0-insider
Commit f39385b8326671dc6389f21f8c2e2f6afdb352a1
Date 2017-08-01T05:10:12.703Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0
Architecture x64

Linux

Testing "Rename some terminals through the gear icon on the right." 

Start VS Code
Open a new terminal with ctrl+backtick
Press `cmd+P`, then type in `term`
Click on the gear, you can rename
Delete the terminal 
Open a new terminal with ctrl+backtick
Press `cmd+P`, type in `term`
Click on the gear

Result: Can no longer rename.

data.title: *nix users should automatically require ctrl-click
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (6328bae2bf8382fd4abd054c14976548eaea66cf, 2017-07-27T07:00:51.592Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-28-generic
- Extensions: none
---

Following on the heels of #21506, I feel that the default click action for *nix users should not be alt-click, but ctrl-click.

What's odd is I only see references to ctrl-click in the issue, but somehow...

![selection_017](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/923011/28844323-423fc932-76d2-11e7-8d30-12afd24e0370.png)

Alt-click is mapped by default in Ubuntu window manager to move windows, so alt-click in this case does nothing (or rather, it moves the vscode window)

Perhaps this is more a question than a bug, but:

1. Is this configurable in `settings.json`, so it is ctrl-click?
2. If not, can the default be changed to ctrl-click so it functions on Ubuntu at least?

data.title: [debug] Is StackTraceResponse.totalFrames truly necessary?
data.body:
The description of `supportsDelayedStackTraceLoading` debug adapter capability stipulates that in order for delayed stack loading to work, the adapter must populate the `totalFrames` field of `StackTraceResponse`.    

However, for native debuggers, this value is not so easy to compute.  For example, when FPO (frame pointer omission) optimization is in play, the debugger may need to load debug info for *all* modules currently on stack, even those at the very bottom which the user probably didn't care about.

Since the total number of frames is never surfaced in the UI, I am wondering whether `totalFrames` is truly necessary.  Wouldn't VSCode know that it has reached bottom of the stack when it receives back less frames than the `levels` it requested?

data.title: KeyBindings Editor: Context menu via keyboard causes list jump and secondary popup
data.body:
Windows 7
Code 1.14.2
Insiders 8-1

Related/Expanded Issue #23614

Steps to reproduce: (note all operations by keyboard)

- open KeyBindings Editor
- Tab into key bindings list
- Arrow down several lines
- Use ContextMenu key (Shift-F10)

-PopUp menu appears and list entry jumps several lines up or  down
- Selecting Edit KeyBinding causes a second PopUp menu to appear
- If a new key binding is set, it will be applied to the entry after the jump

- After doing the above trying to edit again will cause the second pop up again but without list jumping

I would like to post a video if it will make it clearer can someone suggest a screen capture program especially that has good keyword activation ?

data.title: The VSCode is showing a different file version if comparable with git version
data.body:
This error occurs forever. The file is different of the last version in git.
I tried change the branch but don't works. If I open the same file in another editor, it works.

- macOS Sierra version 10.12.5 (16F73)
- git version 2.11.0 (Apple Git-81)
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
beautify|Hoo|1.1.1
vscode-svgviewer|css|1.4.2
vue|liu|0.1.5
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open project (in my case its cordova app).
2. Edit the project and commit this progress in git.
3. Change branch without VSCode, and continue to edit this project and commit the changes.
4. Returns to previous branch, and follow the step 3.
5. Compare the version files between VSCode and another Editor.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: TS Version Selector shows wrong label
data.body: Testing #31785 Followed these steps: On new folder without user settings, version selector shows this ![screen shot 2017-08-01 at 11 37 25 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16890566/28841014-bba2b4f8-76ad-11e7-9d50-45c0630075ec.png) On same folder with user setting `typescript.tsdk` pointing to a global TS, version selector shows this ![screen shot 2017-08-01 at 11 34 30 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16890566/28841003-adb15d0e-76ad-11e7-8934-40a4309dae90.png) Both are labeled as `Use VS Code's version` Shouldn't the former say "Use Bundled version" and the latter say `Use configured version`?

data.title: Terminal Switcher: Rename terminal should be populated and have selection
data.body:
While testing #31784.

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (f39385b8326671dc6389f21f8c2e2f6afdb352a1, 2017-08-01T05:07:59.267Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a terminal
2. Select `Terminal: Switch Active Terminal` from the command palette
3. <kbd>ArrowDown</kbd> to the terminal in the switcher
4. Move keyboard focus to rename action using 2 <kbd>Tab</kbd>s. See #31835.
5. <kbd>Enter</kbd> to enter rename mode
-> text box is empty. This is fine if I want to assign a completely new name, but an issue if I only want to correct a typo for example. The input box should contain the old name and the name should be selected so that I can start typing to replace or use Arrow keys to get to the right place to correct the typo.
